column1: A Mexican mother tells her tragedy to warn other parents and avoid someone else going through what she’s living: the loss of her 2-years-old baby.
When she came back from work
column2: she came into her baby’s room. When she got near to kiss him
column3: she felt he had a fever. She imagined it was just a common cold and thought about a home remedy to relieve him.

column1: She rubbed Vick VapoRub on his chest
column2: back
column3: and under his nose to help him breathe. She tucked him up and laid down next to him.

column1: She was tired
column2: so she fell asleep next to her baby. Hours later
column3: when she woke up
column4: she noticed her son wasn’t breathing.

column1: She carried him and took it to the hospital to save him. But
column2: sadly
column3: everything was pointless
column4: the baby had been dead for hours.

column1: The medical report stated the child died due to inflammation in the respiratory track
column2: produced by the camphor contained in the famous ointment.

column1: She never imagined that home remedy would take his baby. She only wanted to help him breathe
column2: and the ointment did exactly the opposite.

column1: The thing is
column2: this remedy is effective for adults; however
column3: for babies younger than two years old
column4: the ointment increases the mucus by 60%. The mucus accumulates on the trachea and blocks the breathing.

column1: The label warns the ointment is contraindicated for children younger than 3 years old.
Sadly
column2: in the case of the Mexican mother
column3: the warning went unnoticed. Using home remedies for several affections is something common in homes around the world
column4: but we hope this story draw attention to this fact: when children are concerned
column5: we must always read the labels and ask for the advice of experts before using any home remedy.

column2: at least parts of them

column4: New York. The barrel
column5: which contained the arms
column6: legs and heads of the three women
column7: was filled with what the medical examiner calls a “crude preservative.”

column1: That means that whoever put them in there wanted to be able to visit them later. Investigators were hoping to find the torsos in the second barrel recovered but found nothing but women’s shoes inside
column2: all brand new in boxes withy the tags still on them. One investigator called it “the weirdest thing he’s ever seen.”

column1: The three women
column2: all of whom were in their late teens or early 20s
column3: were hitchhiking their way from California to New York in 1974 when they disappeared. Their last known location before heading back onto the road was a motel just outside of Little Rock.

column1: 22	"Last night
column2: a twitter account by the name of @solikearose tweeted out a surprising image of CNN broadcasting porn instead of Anthony Bourdain’s scheduled show Parts Unknown. And then without really much questioning
column3: a bunch of news sites ran with it
column4: claiming that the network showed the footage for about 30 minutes. Here are some screenshots grabbed by Mediaite.

column1: It looks like the chaos all started when The Independent wrote up a story from this person’s tweets
column2: which was then tweeted out by the Drudge Report. After that
column3: it spread fast. Mashable
column4: The New York Post
column5: The Daily Mail
column6: Esquire
column7: and Variety have all published a story
column8: and pretty much all of these articles are based on one or two tweets from @solikerose. Plus
column9: many of the original stories didn’t include statements from CNN or RCN
column10: the cable company that supposedly aired the porn.

column1: Fact-checking largely didn’t begin until the stories were published. The @solikearose account has since turned private
column2: and there don’t seem to be any reports of porn airing on CNN last night. RCN also released statements on twitter saying there is no evidence that porn was aired last night in Boston
column3: where @solikearose is supposedly based. ""We are in the process of researching this incident but see no evidence our CNN network feed was compromised last evening in Boston
column4: Jeff Carlson
column5: SVP and general manager of RCN Boston
column6: said in a statement to multiple outlets.

column1: CNN has also released a statement: “The RCN cable operator in Boston aired inappropriate content for 30 minutes on CNN last night. CNN has asked for an explanation.” But that still doesn’t really verify that anything occurred.
@solikearose 800-746-4726. We have not had any reports of the programming issue you mentioned on CNN in Boston. If you're still having an — RCN (@RCNconnects) November 25
@solikearose issue with that channel
column2: please DM us your address so we can troubleshoot when you're home. Thanks
column3: Melissa — RCN (@RCNconnects) November 25

column1: The appeal of the story is obvious: a network news may have aired porn for a full 30 minutes. Hilarious! And the CNN program that was supposed to be on was Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown. It’s a layup for body-part puns.
This is exactly how fake news spreads
But this is exactly how fake news spreads. Even if porn was aired on CNN
column2: it’s clear that a lot of publications ran with a story based on tweets from one person before verifying the facts. Many of the headlines already implicate CNN
column3: claiming the channel aired 30 minutes of porn without giving any context.

column1: The stakes might not seem very high in this case
column2: but fake news seems to have played a major role during the 2016 presidential campaign. column1: 23	"President Donald Trump was very active on Twitter Easter morning and lashed back at protesters wanting to see his tax returns
column2: saying he shouldn’t have to show them since he “easily won the Electoral College.” Moments after he defended no longer calling China a currency manipulator
column3: now that they are giving him a helping hand with North Korea
column4: Trump dismissed calls for his tax returns by responding on Twitter. “I did what was almost an impossible thing to do for a Republican-easily won the Electoral College! Now Tax Returns are brought up again?” Trump tweeted.

column1: As always
column2: his son Eric was there to provide a helping hand in defending his father. During an brief phone interview with KYXL Radio based out of Orlando
column3: Florida
column4: President Trump’s second son argued that his father’s tax return is “irrelevant
column5: ” largely because “he knows all there is to know about following the letter of the law
column6: especially when it comes to paying taxes.” He said
column7: “When you come from a background like the one my father comes from
column8: you have to know all there is about paying taxes and doing your part to make this country a better place.”

column1: Eric continued
column2: “And while we’re on the subject
column3: I kind of have to say
column4: it’s funny how taxes work. They sort of punish the hardest working and most productive members of our society while taking nothing from those who would rather be lazy and beg on the streets. That’s kind of not fair. What he have here is a system that flat out punishes those who want to contribute and make their lives better and at the same time
column5: rewards those who want to be nothing more than dead weight. The worst part is
column6: I’m not saying something that’s revolutionary here; this system has been in place ever since the country was established. My father
column7: regardless of the fact that he’s president
column8: is just one person out of millions of those who are capable enough to be successful but are simultaneously struck down by our tax system. That’s a catastrophe.”

column1: The self-proclaimed businessman then revealed plans to “fix” the broken tax system of the United States. “At the end of the day
column2: it’s irrelevant whether my father choses to disclose his tax return or not. It won’t matter soon anyway
column3: ” Eric argued. Asked to elaborate
column4: he said that President Trump is soon going to move forward with an executive order that “cancels taxes for extra productive people in the U.S. economy.” “It’s our way of saying ‘good job’ to all those hard-working men and women who are single-handedly keeping our national budget afloat by working around the clock and paying their taxes. It is to them that this country owes its gratitude. They are the reason we are the single greatest nation in the world.”

column1: “As for the fact that my father happens to be among the people who are to be freed from paying tax
column2: I can assure you there is no conflict of interest there. This is not a move designed to make it so my father doesn’t have to pay tax; like I said
column3: it’s a sort of ‘thank you’ from him to the entrepreneurs
column4: businessmen and other hard-working Americans who have done their duties thus far. As for the rest
column5: I guess they’ll just have to find some other way to get free meals once the economy starts favoring those who are willing to actually get off their butts and go to work. No more freeloaders
column6: that’s where we’re going with this. Bottom line
column7: if you’ve got two working legs and a minimally functioning brain
column8: you can sustain yourself. And you’re going to have to pretty soon

column1: 24	"Official records filed late yesterday in Westchester County
column2: New York reveal that an individual named Hillary Rodham Clinton has filed divorce from an individual named William Jefferson Clinton.

column1: Additionally
column2: in a separate filing
column3: it appears that Hillary Rodham Clinton has submitted paperwork for a 2016 presidential run.

column1: It has not yet been confirmed whether the individuals in the divorce filings are indeed the former First Lady and Secretary of State
column2: and the 42nd President of the United States. Neither Sec. Hillary Rodham Clinton or President Bill Clinton have issued statements addressing these revelations.

column2: ""A divorce at this stage of the campaign would deliver unbelievable momentum to the candidate
column3: strike an unmistakable chord for Hillary's independence
column4: and it would confound her conservative critics by blowing the email controversy out of the headlines and be the biggest political game-changing divorce of the last several centuries.""

column1: 25	"BREAKING!
Liberal rag Huffington Post is really running with this story from The Washington Post about the CIA “confirming” Russian interference in the presidential election.
They’re saying if 100% true
column2: the courts can PUT HILLARY IN THE WHITE HOUSE!

column1: Scary!
From HuffPo:

A 1995 federal court ruling out of Pennsylvania may offer some clues to Clinton supporters as to possible legal authority for removing an elected official from office and replacing them with their erstwhile opponent.
In light of late-breaking reports Friday evening that Russians interfered with the 2016 presidential election to assist Donald Trump’s victory
column2: Clinton supporters are furiously in pursuit of remedies.

column1: At 10:45 p.m. Friday evening
column2: the Washington Post broke an explosive story alleging that Russians had interfered with the 2016 presidential election in order to assist Donald Trump in a victory over democratic candidate Hillary Clinton. The story reveals that a CIA assessment detailing this conclusion had been presented to President Obama and top congressional leaders last week.

column1: The development has Clinton supporters and other concerned Americans confused and hot in pursuit of potential remedies. No clear constitutional remedy exists to halt the certification of the outcome. Article II of the U.S. Constitution vests Congress with the power to determine the date by which the Electoral College will cast their votes
column2: presently set for December 19. In recent weeks
column3: a massive online movement asking members of the Electoral College to become “faithless” or “conscientious” electors and to vote for Clinton instead of Trump has garnered national attention.

column1: The electors would be well within their constitutional authority to do so
column2: say groups like Hamilton’s Electors
column3: which claims that the purpose of the Electoral College is to prevent demagogues like Mr. Trump from assuming the nation’s highest office. A petition urging the Electoral College to make Hillary Clinton president has gained nearly 5 million signatures.

column1: Proponents of this strategy are concerned
column2: with good reason
column3: about the likelihood it will succeed. With Donald Trump having won 306 Electoral College votes
column4: 37 Republican electors would need to switch their votes to Clinton
column5: a tall order
column6: and in the event that no one candidate has 270 electoral votes
column7: the decision would go to the Republican-controlled House of Representatives."	breaking liberal rag huffington post really running with this story from the washington post about the cia column1: 26	"On Sunday
column2: ex-Rep. Michelle Bachmann spoke with Breitbart News about the protests outside of a Donald Trump campaign stop in Minneapolis
column3: claiming that the protesters acted violently toward Trump supporters. Bachmann argued that President Obama has “sanctioned” violence
column4: as long it protects the “people favorable to the Obama position
column5: politically.” She insisted that the president is sending “a signal to Donald Trump supporters: Don’t attend Donald Trump events because you could be physically assaulted.” She also linked the Obama administration’s “lawlessness” to the incident in Minneapolis
column6: claiming that Obama has effectively condoned violence against conservatives and white people
column7: leaving “normal” people helpless in the face of anarchy.

column1: “And these days it has become so obvious that I’m honestly surprised we’re not having riots throughout the country
column2: ” she said. “When did this become a nation of criminals? I didn’t get that memo. And if you look at it
column3: if you just take a look at how many white people and conservative people have suffered because of violence in the past 8 years alone
column4: it will become very clear that this is something only a highly powerful apparatus is capable of organizing. You know
column5: the kind of apparatus we like to call the Obama administration. I’m not sure what other Americans are thinking
column6: but as for me
column7: I feel like the last 8 years were the absolute worst time to be white in America.”

column1: The ex-Rep. then argued that “not even slaves” suffered as much as white people are being targeted nowadays. “It’s true
column2: once it was also terribly inconvenient to be black in this country. And yes
column3: African-Americans have suffered greatly at the hand of white people
column4: I’m not going to try to deny that. But one thing must be very clear – we’re supposed to be all evolved right now
column5: we’re supposed to have learned from our mistakes. That means that there should be no more racial tensions in America at all. And yet
column6: what is our president doing? He’s protecting those who want to hurt white people
column7: as you’ve seen in Minneapolis.”

column1: “In fact
column2: ” Bachmann continued firing
column3: “I don’t think all of the suffering of African-Americans during the period of slavery can ever equate to what’s been done to white conservative Americans in the past 8 years of Obama’s presidency.” She added
column4: “Because
column5: let’s face it
column6: during that time
column7: we’ve had the Supreme Court’s decision to legalize same-sex marriage
column8: we’ve had countless terrorist attacks
column9: we’ve had many racial killings and crimes and we’ve had several small-scale revolutions in some of America’s major cities. Is that the legacy President Obama wants to be remembered by? Does he really want to go down in history as the man who created a gap between black people and white people? Judging by his actions during his presidency
column10: I’m guessing he does.”

column1: “And let’s get one thing straight – I’m not just saying this because I happen to be white. No
column2: even if I were Asian or Hindu or Martian
column3: whatever
column4: I’d be saying the same thing all over again
column5: ” Bachmann quipped. “That’s what I’m trying to point out – white people in America have gone through so much in the last 8 years as a race that I’m seriously worried whether or not we’ll still be around come 2025. Because
column6: at the rate we’re going
column7: all we need is another black president four years from now and we’ll be done
column8: just like that. Muslims are coming in on one side
column9: foreigners from the other
column10: a black president on yet another – white people today have been reduced to something even worse off than slaves. And that’s just one step away from extinction
column11: ” Bachmann concluded./politicot.com

27	"PRETORIA – South African Paralympic gold medallist
column2: Oscar Pistorious hanged himself in his prison cell where he was serving a jail term for the murder of Reeva Steenkamp
column3: prison officials said on Saturday.

column1: Pistorious
column3: was a celebrated Olympian and Paralympic gold medalist before fatally shooting his girlfriend Reeva on Valentine’s Day in 2013. He was convicted of the killing and sentenced to 6 years in prison a year ago.

column1: Staff at the Atteridgeville Correctional Centre in Pretoria
column2: found Pistorious hanging in his prison cell at 5:30 am local time on Sunday. He was taken to a nearby hospital
column3: where he was pronounce dead an hour later.

column1: “Mr. Pistorious hanged himself utilizing a bed sheet that he attached to his cell window
column2: ” the state corrections commission said in a statement. “Mr. Pistorious also attempted to block his door from the inside by jamming the door with various items.”

column1: His body has since been deposited at the morgue awaiting autopsy.

column2: I said nothing and gave them a look that said “don’t ask me anymore questions!”. They didn’t ask
column3: and I didn’t tell. That experience frightened me so bad that I decided to put my sexual desires on hold and focused on my education. That meant pulling back from my “gay friends” too
column4: because I was starting to get a little too reckless and free with my sexuality. I started hanging more with my straight friends. After all
column5: I had to keep my charade up. I had family that attended my school
column6: so I couldn’t be seen with a bunch of gay men 24/7.

column1: 8 months later while home for Christmas break I had to see my doctor for my yearly checkup. This was something my mother made me do ever year since I can remember. My doctor asked me was I sexually active
column2: and I said no. I told him that I had sex once
column3: but that was it. I wasn’t sexually active
column4: because I wasn’t actively having sex. He told me that he was going to include an HIV test in my regular blood work anyway. A few days later I received a call from his office. It wasn’t the doctor
column5: it was one of the office workers. She was obviously new
column6: because I didn’t recognize her voice. She told me that I needed to come in
column7: because there was something that the doctor needed to discuss with me. I was confused. I asked her what “something” was
column8: and she said that she couldn’t release this information over the phone and that I should come in Today. This was very unusual
column9: because I had never had this happen before and I had been getting a yearly checkup from the same doctor for over 15 years. At first I thought it could be high blood pressure
column10: because that ran in my family. There was also a chance of cancer
column11: because the women in my family had breast cancer and my grandfather passed away from prostate cancer. I borrowed my mothers car
column12: and headed over to the doctor’s office. I didn’t want to scare her
column13: so I didn’t mention what I was borrowing the car for.

column1: I will never forget what happened next. As I arrived to my doctor’s office
column2: I was told to have a seat in the waiting room. There was soft music playing that turned out to be Barry Manilow’s Daybreak
column3: and it made my stomach turn! I hated that f***king song. I was in no mood to hear a happy go lucky song when I was being called into my doctor’s office to discuss my lab results. Before the song could end
column4: the doctor opened the door and escorted me to an exam room. It was cold
column5: there was no window
column6: and the light was very bright. Brighter than usual. He began to look over my charts and lab results. He grabbed my hand
column7: which caught me off guard
column8: and then said I’m sorry to have to tell you this
column9: but your HIV results

column1: came back positive. I swear I didn’t even hear the word positive
column2: I just read his lips that seem to go in slow motion. I said
column3: I’m sorry but there must be some mistake. I am not sexually active. I’ve only had sex once! I haven’t had oral sex
column4: or any sexual activity with anyone but one person. He said that he would order additional tests
column5: and they all came back positive.

column1: I thought about committing suicide. I could not eat. I could not sleep. I could not focus on school. I couldn’t do anything but cry. My doctor couldn’t legally tell my mother I was HIV positive
column2: but I was on her insurance so she would find out sooner or later when she saw the co-pays for the HIV meds he prescribed and the increased doctor visits. I tried to get in contact with Stephawn but his number was disconnected.

column1: When I got back to school
column2: I went over to the apartment complex where he lived but I couldn’t remember the apartment number. I had no way of reaching this guy. I wanted to kill him
column3: and i was going to. I had a butcher knife and I was going to stab him thru the heart
column4: because I knew this guy had given me HIV
column5: because I didn’t have sex with anyone else. As time passed
column6: I became so depressed that I eventually dropped out of school. I kept thinking what is the purpose of getting a degree when I’m going to die soon. I lost 15 pounds from not eating and started to look very frail. I decided to drop out of school
column7: because I didn’t know how to deal with it all. I had no one to turn to. I couldn’t tell my friends
column8: and I couldn’t tell my parents. Can you imagine telling your mother that you are HIV positive after a one night stand. I couldn’t dare to see the pain in her eyes of knowing her son is going to die before her.

column1: Today I read the article about Isaac Burks and saw his picture. This is the same guy who told me his name was Stephawn. This is the guy that gave me HIV! He ruined my life. I finally ended up telling my parents because I could not afford to pay the co-pays for the medication and doctor visits. My mother didn’t cry
column2: and told me that she loved me and would be there for me every step of the way. Later on that night as I got up to use the bathroom I heard her crying in her room. Tears immediately started pouring down my face and I ran to the kitchen. I slit my wrist. I wanted to die. I fell out and woke up in the hospital surrounded by my family. I have been in counseling
column3: hiv support groups
column4: and seeing a psychiatrist every since. Accepting the fact that I am HIV positive has been very hard. I still have not been able to return to school
column5: and I have tried to kill myself 3 times since then.

column1: To the sick f***k Isaac Burks
column2: also known as Stephawn who gave me HIV
column3: I hope you rott in hell. Now that I know his real name I will contact the authorities and tell my story. Every day I hope that things will get better
column4: and it doesn’t. I ask “Why me?” every day. What did I do to deserve this? I have not been able to date or have any sexual relations with anyone. I just know the minute I tell them my HIV status they will be out of the door. I am going to die alone. The last time I tried to commit suicide by swallowing a bottle of sleeping pills I woke up to my mother crying and begging me to stop. But I cant. I have nothing to live for. I am alive
column5: but I am not living.

column1: I cried as I typed this post. I relived it
column2: but felt I had to share my story. After finally coming out to my friends with my story I later found out that there were others that this man infected with HIV.

column1: 34	"Johnny Depp made a big mistake when he threatened to assassinate President Trump. His little stand-up routine
column2: that wasn’t funny
column3: has now landed him in the back of a black SUV on the way to a federal holding facility for questioning.

column1: Special Agent Bob Argueta was barking orders at other people at the scene before we enticed him with jerky to give us a statement. Skip Tetheluda
column2: whose jerky has landed more than a few exclusive interviews
column3: says Argueta was told to take Depp deep and dark into the night
column4: make sure they weren’t followed and bring him for advanced interrogation. He responded to allegations that this takes a joke by an actor way too far:

column1: “People just assume he was kidding. What they don’t know is that Depp actually had maps and timetables and plans to assassinate President Trump if he ever visited Concord
column2: New Hampshire again
column3: which he certainly would during the 2020 general election season.

column1: Depp is a dangerous criminal. Some of the content on his computer indicate he may have been radicalized while he was studying in Muslim waters for his Captain Jack Sparrow role.”

There you have it. If they found out Depp was a Muslim convert with plans to kill the President he may never see the light of day again. It’s difficult to think of our favorite actors as such horrible people sometimes
column2: but Hollywood is just filled with tree-hugging
column3: self-righteous
column4: Prius driving freaks.

35	"Seth Rich Seth Rich
- EDITOR'S NOTE (5/17/17): We want to update you on a story you first saw on FOX 5 DC. We want to make an important clarification on claims that were made by Rod Wheeler
column2: the private investigator hired by Seth Rich's family
column3: whose services are being paid for by a third party.

column1: What he told FOX 5 DC on camera Monday regarding Seth Rich's murder investigation is in clear contrast to what he has said over the last 48 hours. Rod Wheeler has since backtracked.
In an interview Monday
column2: Wheeler told FOX 5 DC he had sources at the FBI confirming there was evidence of communication between Seth Rich and WikiLeaks. This is the verbatim of that exchange:

column1: FOX 5 DC: “You have sources at the FBI saying that there is information...”
WHEELER: ""For sure...""
FOX 5 DC: “...that could link Seth Rich to WikiLeaks?""
WHEELER: ""Absolutely. Yeah. That's confirmed.""
In the past 48 hours
column2: Rod Wheeler has told other media outlets he did not get his information from FBI sources
column3: contradicting what he told us on Monday.

column1: Since Rod Wheeler backtracked Tuesday
column2: FOX 5 DC attempted incessantly to communicate with him
column3: but he didn't return calls or emails.

column1: On Wednesday
column2: just before our newscast
column3: Wheeler responded to our requests via a telephone conversation
column4: where he now backtracks his position and Wheeler characterizes his on-the-record and on-camera statements as ""miscommunication.""

column1: When asked if Wheeler is still working for Seth Rich's family
column2: Wheeler told FOX 5 DC the contract still stands-- ties have not been severed.

column1: We reached out once again to the Rich family
column2: and through a spokesperson the Rich family tells FOX 5 DC
column3: ""The family has relayed their deep disappointment with Rod Wheeler's conduct over the last 48 hours
column4: and is exploring legal avenues to the family.""

column1: Original story:
It has been almost a year since Democratic National Committee staffer Seth Rich was murdered in the nation's capital. There have been no solid answers about why he was killed until now.
Rich was shot and killed last July in Northwest D.C and police have suggested the killing in the District's Bloomingdale neighborhood was a botched robbery. However
column2: online conspiracy theories have tied the murder to Rich's work at the DNC.

column1: Just two months shy of the one-year anniversary of Rich's death
column2: FOX 5 has learned there is new information that could prove these theorists right.

column1: Rod Wheeler
column2: a private investigator hired by the Rich family
column3: suggests there is tangible evidence on Rich's laptop that confirms he was communicating with WikiLeaks prior to his death. Wheeler's services were offered to the family and paid for by a third party
column4: according to a statement issued by the Rich family Tuesday which also includes that ""the private investigator who spoke to press was offered to the Rich family and paid for by a third party
column5: and contractually was barred from speaking to press or anyone outside of law enforcement or the family unless explicitly authorized by the family.""

column1: Now
column2: questions have been raised on why D.C. police
column3: the lead agency on this murder investigation for the past ten months
column4: have insisted this was a robbery gone bad when there appears to be no evidence to suggest that.

column1: Wheeler
column2: a former D.C. police homicide detective
column3: is running a parallel investigation into Rich’s murder. He said he believes there is a cover-up and the police department has been told to back down from the investigation.

column1: The police department nor the FBI have been forthcoming
column2: ” said Wheeler. “They haven't been cooperating at all. I believe that the answer to solving his death lies on that computer
column3: which I believe is either at the police department or either at the FBI. I have been told both.”

column1: When we asked Wheeler if his sources have told him there is information that links Rich to Wikileaks
column2: he said
column3: “Absolutely. Yeah. That's confirmed.""

column1: Wheeler also told us
column2: ""I have a source inside the police department that has looked at me straight in the eye and said
column3: ‘Rod
column4: we were told to stand down on this case and I can’t share any information with you.’ Now
column5: that is highly unusual for a murder investigation
column6: especially from a police department. Again
column7: I don’t think it comes from the chief’s office
column8: but I do believe there is a correlation between the mayor's office and the DNC and that is the information that will come out [Tuesday].

column1: Wheeler told FOX 5 that he will provide us with a full report with the new details.

FOX 5's Melanie Alnwick spoke with D.C. Police on Tuesday and was told that Wheeler’s assertion that a source inside the department told him that detectives were instructed to stand down regarding the Rich case was false.
The family sent Alnwick a statement on Tuesday with the following statement:
As we've seen through the past year of unsubstantiated claims
column2: we see no facts
column3: we have seen no evidence
column4: we have been approached with no emails and only learned about this when contacted by the press. Even if tomorrow
column5: an email was found
column6: it is not a high enough bar of evidence to prove any interactions as emails can be altered and we've seen that those interested in pushing conspiracies will stop at nothing to do so. We are a family who is committed to facts
column7: not fake evidence that surfaces every few months to fill the void and distract law enforcement and the general public from finding Seth's murderers. The services of the private investigator who spoke to press was offered to the Rich family and paid for by a third party
column8: and contractually was barred from speaking to press or anyone outside of law enforcement or the family unless explicitly authorized by the family.""

40	"House Speaker Paul Ryan (R-WI) this week disputed reports that 22 million people would lose insurance under the Republican health care plan. During an interview that aired on Tuesday
column2: Fox News host Brian Kilmeade asked Ryan to respond to a recent Congressional Budget Office (CBO) report that said there would be 22 million more people without health insurance by 2026 if the Senate’s version of the health care bill is signed into law. “What they are basically saying at the Congressional Budget Office
column3: if you’re not going to force people to buy Obamacare
column4: if you’re not going to force people to buy something they don’t want
column5: then they won’t buy it
column6: ” the Speaker opined. “So
column7: it’s not that people are getting pushed off a plan
column8: it’s that people will choose not to buy something that they don’t like or want.”

column1: Kilmeade then asked Ryan to comment on the fact that the Republican health care platform is going to make health insurance plans significantly less affordable by decreasing subsidies for poorer Americans. Ryan replied by ranting about how being poor is “a choice.” “This is something we’ve been over on more than once occasion
column2: ” Ryan said. “I know why you’re asking me this; you want me to feel guilty for depriving 22 million people of health insurance
column3: right? Well
column4: I’m sorry Brian
column5: but it’s not working. And the reason why it’s not working is
column6: you’re using the wrong logic here. You’re using the wrong logic alongside millions of other Americans
column7: because all of you feel that those who get up every day and work hard for some reason owe something to those who just lie around doing nothing. That’s not right.”

column4: in this case

column8: one has to be willing to work hard. And that’s the only condition

column10: you can afford whatever you want

column13: then this is something that guarantees your success. But
column14: if you choose to be lazy all day and expect the government to take care of you
column15: then you’re doomed.”

column1: 43	"Australia Becomes First Country To Begin Microchipping Its Public
Australia may become the first country in the world to microchip its public. NBC news predicted that all Americans would be microchipped by 2017
column2: but it seems Australia may have already beaten them to it. Back in 2010
column3: CBS news reported that the Australian government had a potential RFID microchipping plan in the works related to the health care system.

column1: Now
column2: it seems that this plan is beginning to unfold but the push is not a result of mandated health care reforms
column3: but rather a clever propaganda campaign that equates RFID microchipping with becoming superhuman
column4: and people are begging for it.

column1: Under the headline ‘Australians embracing super-human microchip technology’
column2: Australia’s premier media outlet news.com.au (News Corp Australia) reports: It may sound like sci-fi
column3: but hundreds of Australians are turning themselves into super-humans who can unlock doors
column4: turn on lights and log into computers with a wave of the hand.

column1: Shanti Korporaal
column2: from Sydney
column3: is at the centre of the phenomenon after having two implants inserted under her skin. Now she can get into work and her car without carrying a card or keys
column4: and says her ultimate goal is to completely do away with her wallet and cards.

column1: She told news.com.au:
“You could set up your life so you never have to worry about any password or PINs it’s the same technology as Paypass
column2: so I’m hoping you’ll be able to pay for things with it.”

column1: “With Opal you get a unique identification number that could be programmed into the chip. Any door with a swipe card … it could open your computer
column2: photocopier. Loyalty cards for shops are just another thing for your wallet.”

column1: The microchips
column2: which are the size of a grain of rice
column3: can act like a business card and transfer contact details to smartphones
column4: and hold complex medical data. In her interview with the Australian news outlet
column5: Shanti claims that her friends and family are envious of her microchip lifestyle:

column1: “My nana wants one. I’ve had more opposition to my tattoos than I’ve ever had to the chip. My friends are jealous.”
In fact
column2: the 27-year-old has noticed a business opportunity and set up a distribution service called Chip My Life with her husband
column3: Skeeve Stevens where for just $80 to $140
column4: people can become so called “super humans.” On the same day this news story broke
column5: Shanti appeared at Austarlia’s launch of the much anticipated cyborg themed video game Deus Ex Mankind Divided
column6: alongside American implantable technology pioneer Amal Graafstra.

column1: As you can see
column2: the push for RFID microchipping and assimilating the human population with robots and technology
column3: is something that will most likely be sold to the public as helping them to become “super human
column4: ” but clearly if you become part machine/computer
column5: that means there will be someone who can control that technology. If you think the elites wouldn’t capitalize on such an exceptional opportunity to control the population you obviously don’t know history very well.

column1: Amal Graafstra
column2: who became one of the world first RFID implantees back in 2005
column3: just made headlines recently in the US with a prototype of the world’s first implant-activated smart gun and is a huge proponent for this new technology.

column1: He’s written a book
column2: spoken at TEDx and also appeared in a number of documentaries.

column1: In an interview with the Australian media outlet
column2: Amal explained that the technology he has implanted into his body has “given me the ability to communicate with machines. It’s literally integrated into who I am.”

column1: Shanti has bought into the culture that dominates society today
column2: which is one dominated by the fantasy of super heroes that mesmerizes the population at theaters all across the globe.

column1: Ever since watching movies like the Terminator
column2: Matrix and Minority Report I wondered if we could actually live like that. I always wondered why we all weren’t living as ‘super-humans’.

44	"Edward Snowden: Osama Bin Laden is Still Alive Living in the Bahamas:

Edward Snowden (the NSA whistleblower) has made another astonishing revelation. He apparently has documents that prove Osama Bin Laden is on the CIA’s payroll and currently living a luxury lifestyle in the Bahamas.

column2: Edward Snowden
column3: a former contractor for the National Security Agency (NSA)
column4: released various documents regarding government surveillance programs. This resulted in him being charged for committing several crimes.

column1: All of the charges carry a sentence of up to 10 years in prison. Due to this and the fact he believed it was the correct decision to reveal the shocking extent of phone surveillance by U.S. intelligence agency
column2: he had no choice but to flee.

column1: He currently resides in Russia
column2: this is where he has be offered asylum for one year. Snowden has yet again provided a shocking piece of information. The Moscow Tribune reports that Snowden claims that Osama Bin Laden the infamous former leader of Al Qaeda
column3: is in fact still alive and is in receipt of cash courtesy of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).

column1: “I have documents showing that Bin Laden is still on the CIA’s payroll
column2: ” Snowden claims. “He is still receiving more than $100
column3: 000 a month
column4: which are being transferred through some front businesses and organizations
column5: directly to his Nassau bank account. I am not certain where he is now
column6: but in 2013
column7: he was living quietly in his villa with five of his wives and many children.”

column1: Snowden claims the CIA faked the death of Osama Bin Laden. After reporting him dead
column2: the man himself and his family were moved to a secret location in the Bahamas.

column1: “Osama Bin Laden was one of the CIA’s most efficient operatives for a long time
column2: ” Snowden claims. “What kind of message would it send their other operatives if they were to let the SEALs kill him? They organized his fake death with the collaboration of the Pakistani Secret services
column3: and he simply abandoned his cover. Since everyone believes he is dead
column4: nobody’s looking for him
column5: so it was pretty easy to disappear. Without the beard and the military jacket
column6: nobody recognizes him.”

column1: NaijaPicks say that these documents that prove this controversial claim are featured in his 2015 book.
Despite the fact Snowden says he was trying to help the citizens of America by releasing these documents
column2: he is still classed as a fugitive in the USA. This is also despite approximately 168
column3: 000 people signing a petition calling for Snowden to be pardoned. This was rejected by the White House rejected on July 28

column1: Whilst resident in Hong Kong
column2: Snowden was interviewed by several journalists inside a secret location. He was asked why he left his own country
column3: his reply to The Guardian was:

column1: “I don’t want to live in a society that does these sort of things… I do not want to live in a world where everything I do and say is recorded.”

column2: 39 of Chicago
column3: was arrested in connection with a series of dead bodies found in a freezer located in his basement. According to reports
column4: the bodies had the words “Black Lives Matter” carved into the foreheads of the corpses.

column1: The Chicago coroners office made a gruesome discovery today after several 911 calls were placed by neighbors regarding their concern of suspicious activity at the residence of Thompson. At approximately 8 p.m.
column2: police were dispatched to South Pulaski Road and West Lexington Street. Upon their arrival
column3: their arrival
column4: authorities were met by a group of residents at the corner where they assisted police in locating the home in question. Police proceeded to the 3000 Block of West Lexington Street where they located the home. Authorities knocked on the door of the residence and was met by an African-American male
column5: who appeared to be in his late 30’s and seemed to be “under the influence of drugs”.

column1: Upon entering the home
column2: authorities indicated that the home “smelled of death”. The power was off in the house however authorities found a gasoline powered generated running in the kitchen.

column1: “A Black male
column2: approximately in his 30’s
column3: opened the door with the smell of alcohol and marijuana on his body. He appeared to be somewhat disoriented and his speech was slurred. We asked him for permission to enter the premises
column4: however he seems reluctant to allow us to enter
column5: ” said Lt. Kyle Jennings. “After a few seconds
column6: he mumbled “yes” to us. Once we entered the home
column7: we were met with a very foul odor as if something was dead in the home. The power was off so we used our flash lights to look around. As we approached the rear of the home
column8: a light was on in the kitchen. We asked the occupant for his name. He identified himself and told us he lived with his grandmother. In the kitchen
column9: we found several handsaws covered in blood. Mr. Thompson pushed one of the officers and ran downstairs through a half-opened door in the kitchen.”

column1: Lt. Jennings and two other officers chased Thompson down the stairs which is where the foul odor had gotten stronger. When the officers got to the basement
column2: they found a series of freezers scattered around the basement. With no trace of Thompson
column3: one officer continued to search for him as the other two pried opened three locked deep freezers. Upon their discovery
column4: 11 decapitated bodies were found frozen
column5: while the heads where in ziplock freezer bags. All of the bodies appeared to have been Caucasian women
column6: possibly in their early to mid-20’s. The heads that were found all had the words “Black Lives Matter” carved into the foreheads. The bodies were were preserved
column7: possibly from being stored in the deep freezers.

column1: The police radioed for back up and the other freezers were opened where 8 more bodies in similar condition were found
column2: however one of the women was still alive. Authorities at the scene helped the woman out of the freezer and waited for paramedics to arrive.

column1: “I was kidnapped by this Black guy after I left work earlier today. We talked for while at Starbucks
column2: where I work

column4: but that is when everything went dark. When I woke up

column6: ” said to police by the victim.

column1: Officer Douglas
column2: who was searching for Thompson
column3: found him in a crawl space in the basement. Police ran a background check on him and discovered that he was arrested during a protest for the police involved shooting death of Laquan McDonald. Thompson had no prior criminal record according to authorities.

column1: The names of the victims have not been released. column1: 54	"The White House has approved the redesign of U.S. currency.  Barack Obama will be on the new dollar bill.
The Obama Administration feels that the American dollar is in bad need of a makeover.  They have partnered with the Dollar ReDe$ign Project to pick a new design for U.S. currency.  Currently
column2: the design that the administration likes best was done by Dowling Duncan (a British duo)
column3: which features a unique vertical design.  It also features President Obama on the one dollar bill.

column1: “We love the Dowling Duncan look.  They’ve come up with a creative design and put President Obama where he belongs… on number 1
column2: ” said David Axelrod
column3: Senior Adviser to President Obama.

column1: The Dollar Redesign Project was organized by creative strategy consultant Richard Smith.  He is still soliciting ideas for the dollar bill of the future. “Our great ‘rival’
column2: the Euro
column3: looks so spanky in comparison it seems the only clear way to revive this global recession is to rebrand and redesign
column4: ” the project notes on its website.

column1: Here’s the web site for  The Dollar Redesign Project.
“Don’t waste your time submitting a design
column2: it’s a done deal
column3: ” said Rahm Emanuel
column4: White House Chief of Staff.  The President wants “change” in the currency and we’ve unanimously picked Dowling Duncan’s work.  Fed Chairman
column5: Benjamin Bernanke
column6: has signed off on our choice for the redesign.  We intend to have the money in circulation by December

column1: Emanuel went on to say that there are plans to redo U.S. coins as well.  “We don’t need a complete redesign of our coins
column2: but we do want to put President Obama on the penny and move President Lincoln to the nickel. Thomas Jefferson
column3: who was on the nickel
column4: will be… discontinued.”  Republican  Congressman Paul Ryan suggested President Obama be  put on both the “nickel and dime” instead of the penny.

column1: Another American icon might also be replaced.  “Uncle Sam is outdated
column2: ” said Axelrod.  “We need to update this icon as well.  It will now be Uncle Barack.”

column1: Republicans are apoplectic about the changes the Administration is proposing.  “They won’t get this passed when we get control of the house
column2: ” said Minority Leader John Boehner.  “Typical Republicans
column3: they want to block everything
column4: even a little meaningless design issue
column5: ” said Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi.  “It doesn’t matter what they think
column6: we’re going to pass this and every American will be carrying Obama dollars in their wallets and purses come December

column1: Asked to comment on his approval of a piece of legislation that basically promotes hatred towards women once stripped of all the legal terms
column2: Pence argued in an interview with The Huffington Post that “abortion as such was a mistake since the day it was first invented.” “So
column3: let’s get that straight right away – I oppose abortion for any reason whatsoever because I believe that killing someone
column4: or something
column5: if you will
column6: that hasn’t developed a consciousness just yet is the ultimate act of crime. And if we’re murderers of innocent beings who can’t defend themselves
column7: how are we to expect people with a fully developed consciousness to stop murdering each other?” the Indiana governor said.

column1: “And as if that wasn’t enough
column2: ” Pence continued
column3: “we’ve got this situation now throughout different states where some lawmakers allow abortion under some circumstances like rape or when the fetus is diagnosed with an illness
column4: and others just flat out prohibit it. And that’s bad for a number of reasons. First and foremost – we can’t have this kind of freedom of choice. This is bad

column6: because I believe abortion
column7: or I’m going to flat out call it murder
column8: this murdering of children has to stop and it has to be prohibited in every state. So Indiana is just a step in the right direction.”

column4: but around the world. I can only imagine what it must be like to experience such trauma
column5: ” he said. “However

column7: not even that justifies murdering a baby
column8: not in my book. Because what would happen? We’d then have an epidemic of women claiming to have been raped just so they could have an abortion. And that has to be stopped at all cost.”

58	"The recently installed CEO of Donald Trump was accused of domestic violence against his second wife
column2: who later said he threatened to leave her penniless unless she failed to testify against him. According to Politico
column3: Breitbart News chairman Stephen Bannon was charged with battery
column4: dissuading a witness
column5: and misdemeanor domestic violence in connection with a January 1996 incident in the couple’s southern California home.

column1: “I was wondering when this would come up
column2: ” Bannon told Politico. “It’s been a while and given my current position at the head of Donald Trump’s campaign
column3: I was curious to see how long it would take the Democrats to start digging around my past and try to find enough filth and misinformation to use as ammunition to bring me down. And while we’re on the subject
column4: I’m actually disappointed; I honestly didn’t expect them to take this long
column5: ” he said laughingly.

column1: Asked to comment on the validity of the charges against him
column2: Bannon first attempted to circle around a direct answer to the question and said
column3: “Well
column4: look
column5: you know things like these are orchestrated
column6: right? I mean
column7: no one in their right mind would be looking to shoot down people that aren’t targeting them in the first place. And the fact that this is happening right now
column8: like
column9: 20 years later
column10: I mean
column11: it’s just ridiculous. Why would someone be doing this if not to discredit me and in doing so
column12: Donald Trump as well? It’s so obvious I honestly find it hilarious.”

column1: But
column2: once the interviewer persisted in the search for a direct answer
column3: Bannon said
column4: “Alright
column5: look
column6: that’s the thing about marriage
column7: right
column8: you get to do all the things you’re not supposed to in a relationship
column9: that’s the whole beauty of it. And just like there’s no rape in marriage
column10: so too can nobody blame you if you smack your wife around a couple of times so long as you’re doing it out of love. As a matter of fact
column11: I’ll have you know that some women actually enjoy being beaten by their husbands
column12: and I don’t mean that in everyday life. I’m talking about when they’re performing their marital duties
column13: ” he argued.

column1: “So
column2: that’s why I find these charges preposterous
column3: they’re so idiotic that I’m not even sure how they’re still interesting
column4: ” Bannon added. “Because
column5: God made it very clear: when you get married
column6: you have certain duties and obligations to your spouse. And one of those obligations is to love and respect your partner no matter what. And I loved my ex wife
column7: I loved her dearly. I loved all of my wives
column8: but her in particular
column9: just as much as I love my twins to this day.”

column1: “And when you’re in love
column2: everything’s allowed
column3: I don’t care what anyone says
column4: when you say the words ‘I do
column5: ’ and you let your partner put a wedding ring on your finger
column6: you belong to them in every way possible. At no point did I exceed my marital liberties
column7: so why should I
column8: or worse
column9: why should Donald Trump be punished for it?” he concluded.

column1: 60	"There have been many reports about the changes our planet Earth could endure in the months and years to come but many of them didn’t really pan out
column2: making us question everything we read on the internet. But this time
column3: NASA confirms what’s been circling the web recently – our planet Earth will experience total darkness for 15 days in November 2017 starting from November 15 to November 29.

column1: NASA reports that this strange occurrence was expected to happen but they didn’t know exactly when. Upon more detailed examination the astronomers from NASA confirmed that the phenomenon will start on November 15 at 3:00 am and will most likely last until November 30
images (4).jpg
According to experts this blackout will be caused by an astronomical event between Jupiter and Venus. There was even a detailed 1000 pages document written by Charles Bolden
column2: head of NASA explaining the strange event to officials at the White House.

column1: According to the report
column2: during this specific period Jupiter and Venus will come in close proximity of each other and will be separated by just 1 degree. Venus will move to the south-west of Jupiter and as a result it will shine 10 times brighter than Jupiter. Venus’ bright light will heat up the gases in Jupiter causing a reaction which will release a an absurdly high amount of hydrogen into the space. This reaction will come in contact with our Sun at 2:50 am on November 15th.

column1: Once the hydrogen reaches the Sun
column2: a massive explosion is bound to occur on the surface of the Sun
column3: increasing the temperature to more than 9000 degrees. The whole process will generate so much heat that the Sun will change its color into a bluish shade. Once this happens
column4: the Sun will need a minimum of 14 days to restore its normal color and temperature.

column1: As a result of this strange phenomenon
column2: the Sun’s light will be seen much dimmer from the Earth and hence the 15-day blackout NASA is talking about.

column1: “We do not expect any major effects from the Blackout event. column1: 61	"By Free Wood Post
HOUSTON — It seems new National Rifle Association President (NRA) president Jim Porter may have found himself in a bit of hot water.

Not long ago he made his feelings about the Civil War known when he referred to it as the “War of Northern Aggression.” In that same speech he referred to President Obama as a “fake president” and Attorney General Eric Holder as “rabidly un-American.” However none of those remarks that anyone could deem as racist compare to his remarks made at a recent press conference discussing his new leadership role at the NRA.

“I’m very proud to be taking the lead here at the NRA. We need to really buckle down and strap on our best arguments to defend what is our God-given rights. No more northern folk tryin’ take away what is rightfully ours. I will not stand by and let some liberal-elitists try to ruin what has made this country great
column2: especially a liberal of
column3: you know
column4: a different breed.”

column1: When asked to clarify Porter said
“I don’t have to clarify. You know gall darn well what I mean. In fact
column2: it’s only a matter of time before we can own colored people again. They sure as hell won’t be our leaders. It’s out-right embarrassing. The War of Northern Aggression made it all possible
column3: and you be best to know it’s all gonna change back. I’ll be on the front lines making sure it happens. I don’t want my grandkids growing up taking orders from a colored man. It’s our God-given right to keep them as property and keep them in line.”

column1: Several at the NRA
column2: including vice president Wayne LaPierre
column3: have since tried to distance themselves from Porter’s remarks. LaPierre said
column4: “They brought him in over me to try and liven things up
column5: calling me boring and rehearsed. Next time they’d be better off just making me president.”

62	"During a Monday press conference that media outlets were banned from airing
column2: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer announced that the president was sending “thoughts and prayers” to the victims of an alleged terrorist attack in London and to the families of seven dead U.S. sailors. Spicer defended the ban on broadcasting the briefing by noting that President Donald Trump had already appeared on camera on Monday for several minutes
column3: although he took no questions. Spicer also said that the president had confidence in all the members of the Justice Department
column4: including Special Counsel Robert Mueller
column5: who is reportedly investigating the president for obstruction of justice. He also insisted that Trump has the power to fire Mueller if necessary. “If you serve at the pleasure of the president
column6: you serve at the pleasure of the president
column7: ” he said. “That is a fact.”

column1: Asked by several reporters to clarify the full extent of the president’s power
column2: or in other words
column3: its limitations – if they exist – Spicer argued that the Constitution “clearly states” what the President of the United States can and cannot do. “However
column4: ” he added
column5: “one must also recognize the fact that our Constitution was written quite a while ago and
column6: as such
column7: isn’t ideal when it comes to facing the issues that plague the American society nowadays. One of those issues is also the limit of the president’s power. Just like our language and many other things that are typically American
column8: our Constitution is also a living thing that changes and evolves as time goes by. And if it doesn’t do so on its own
column9: then it has us
column10: the people of America
column11: to help it. However
column12: seeing how the people already have more than enough on their plate these days
column13: the president has decided not to bother you folks with such boring decisions.”

column1: Spicer continued
column2: “As a result
column3: the president of the country nowadays has very different legal and executive abilities than those of many of his predecessors
column4: especially some of the first ones like George Washington or Thomas Jefferson. As a matter of fact
column5: in order to be able to deal with the problems of today
column6: which vary incredibly compared to ones that existed when the Constitution was written
column7: Donald Trump has incomparably more power than any other president in the history of our country. In other words
column8: there’s a real need to follow the aforementioned ‘if you serve at the pleasure of the president
column9: you serve at the pleasure of the president’ rule. For example
column10: President Trump not only has the power to fire Robert Mueller; he also has the legal ability and right to cancel and disband the Supreme Court of the United States as well
column11: should he feel the need for it. And no one could argue with such a decision.”

column1: “This is something that’s necessary in order to cope with the daily problems and disasters that go with the territory of living in a technologically advanced time. To make things perfectly clear once again: this is not something that’s exclusive to just Donald Trump; whoever succeeds him as president will also have a slightly higher level of power
column2: because this power is linked to the position
column3: not the man in the position. It is today a requirement as much as it is a logical order of events. It is important that we evolve with the times and not be stuck in the past while everyone else goes past us. We need to retain the proactively flexible approach to life that has been our trademark for so long. That goes especially for interpreting the Constitution of the United States
column4: ” Spicer concluded./politicops.com

column1: Americans have had their eyes opened by the ascension of Donald Trump and no amount of leftwing money can put the Freedom Movement genie back in the bottle.

column6: safer communities

column1: After four months without a single legislative achievement
column2: Congressional and Senatorial Republicans – notably John McCain
column3: Paul Ryan and Lindsey Graham – have joined the Democrats in investigating President Trump absent a single shred of evidence that an underlying crime has been committed.

column1: So

column2: what can only be characterized as
column3: a coup attempt.

column5: from the Revolution through Vietnam.

column1: Today

column4: the pussy hat-wearing feminists

column1: No amount of fake news based on unsubstantiated charges by unnamed sources is going to change that. The battle lines have been drawn and no amount of finger pointing is going to convince these patriots to let anyone overturn the election results.

So why are establishment politicians courting a bloodbath on the streets of America that will also threaten them personally when they could be part of Making America Great Again? column1: EDITORS NOTE: THIS IS NOT A CALL TO ARMS BUT RATHER AN ANALYSIS OF WHAT WOULD HAPPEN IF THE DEEP STATES OVERTURNS A DUELY ELECTED PRESIDENT.
HERE IS A LIST OF EVERY SINGLE TIME OBAMA COMMITTED AN IMPEACHABLE OFFENSE THAT DEMS & MEDIA COVERED UP
“Impeach!” It’s been more than eight years since Democrats uttered that word – long enough for anyone to wonder if it was still in their vocabulary
column2: considering the deafening silence through the dozens of serious scandals during President Obama’s administration – but now that President Trump is the man in the White House
column3: it’s back with a vengeance.

column1: Democrats everywhere are wildly slinging the “I” word
column2: hoping to nail Trump for high crimes and misdemeanors after the New York Times claimed a memo written by former FBI Director James Comey said the president urged him to end the federal investigation into former national security adviser Michael Flynn.

column1: Some members of Congress are getting in on the action. They include Reps. Maxine Water
column2: D-Calif.
column3: and Al Green
column4: D-Texas. Even a Republican
column5: Rep. Justin Amash
column6: claimed Wednesday there are grounds to impeach President Trump. House Oversign Committee Chair Rep. Jason Chaffetz
column7: R-Utah
column8: asked for the alleged Comey memo and other documents. Chaffetz tweeted that he is prepared to subpoena the information. And Sen. John McCain
column9: R-Ariz.
column10: invoked “Watergate.”

column1: Now the Democratic Party is reportedly poll testing impeachment as a 2018 election issue. More than 1 million people signed a petition calling on Congress to impeach Trump.
Wasting no time Wednesday
column2: the mainstream media sprang into action
column3: enthusiastically echoing the left’s impeachment calls. MSNBC launched a Watergate ad implying Trump is America’s new Richard Nixon.

column1: “Watergate. We know its name because there were reporters who never stopped asking questions
column2: ” says MSNBC host Chris Hayes
column3: who hinted that Trump is next on the impeachment chopping block. “Now
column4: who knows where the questions will take us. But I know this: I’m not going to stop asking them.”

column1: Meanwhile
column2: some overzealous members of the left plastered fliers around Washington
column3: D.C.
column4: demanding all White House staffers resign Wednesday.

column1: The posters read: “If you work for this White House you are complicit in hate-mongering
column2: lies
column3: corrupt taking of Americans’ tax money via self-dealing and emoluments
column4: and quite possibly federal crimes and treason. Also
column5: any wars will be on your soul. … Resign now.”

column1: But constitutional scholar Jonathan Turley
column2: who voted for President Obama
column3: warned “impeachment” enthusiasts not to get ahead of themselves with President Trump. Why?

column1: At this time
column2: there’s no evidence Trump actually committed a crime.

column1: “The criminal code demands more than what Comey reportedly describes in his memo
column2: ” Turley wrote in a May 17 opinion piece posted at the Hill. Turley explained:

column1: For the first time
column2: the Comey memo pushes the litany of controversies surrounding Trump into the scope of the United States criminal code.

column1: However
column2: if this is food for obstruction of justice
column3: it is still an awfully thin soup. Some commentators seem to be alleging criminal conduct in office or calling for impeachment before Trump completed the words of his inaugural oath of office. Not surprising
column4: within minutes of the New York Times report
column5: the response was a chorus of breathless “gotcha” announcements. But this memo is neither the Pentagon Papers nor the Watergate tapes. Indeed
column6: it raises as many questions for Comey as it does Trump in terms of the alleged underlying conduct.

column1: A good place to start would be with the federal law
column2: specifically 18 U.S.C. 1503. The criminal code demands more than what Comey reportedly describes in his memo. There are dozens of different variations of obstruction charges ranging from threatening witnesses to influencing jurors. None would fit this case. That leaves the omnibus provision on attempts to interfere with the “due administration of justice.”

column1: However
column2: that still leaves the need to show that the effort was to influence “corruptly” when Trump could say that he did little but express concern for a longtime associate. The term “corruptly” is actually defined differently under the various obstruction provisions
column3: but it often involves a showing that someone acted “with the intent to secure an unlawful benefit for oneself or another.” Encouraging leniency or advocating for an associate is improper but not necessarily seeking an unlawful benefit for him.

According to sgsnews:
NBC Just Fired Megyn Kelly Before Her New Show Begins.

Megyn Kelly turned down a $20 million payday to stay with the only trusted name in news for a daytime slot where she could play a white version of Oprah Winfrey on NBC for 25 percent less money. Now that her tenure at Fox has ended and her new show is scheduled to start production sequences for a fall premiere
column2: Kelly decided she wasn’t happy and demanded the format be changed.

column1: According to Hugh McGovern
column2: executive producer of Kelly’s new show:

column1: “Megyn had high hopes when she left Fox that people would still take her seriously as a journalist. She was lured to NBC with promises of easier days and evenings at home with the family. Now that she sees the production schedule
column2: she feels like she’s been duped and has demanded she be given more serious show assignments.”

column1: The problem
column2: according to McGovern
column3: is that Kelly sees a schedule filled with visits from celebrities and novelists to talk about their sitcoms and books
column4: traveling assignments to dog shows and fashion week and even the addition of a musical guest. According to Maxwell Seawald
column5: CEO of NBC Universal:

column1: “Ms. Kelly wants to be a journalist. Unfortunately
column2: after her stint at Fox News and the way she attacked President Trump
column3: she lost her following. Our data tells us that our audience will tolerate and even learn to like her
column4: but not as a political pundit or someone they should take seriously. She needs to think less Diane Sawyer and more Kelly Ripa.”

column1: Unfortunately
column2: Kelly couldn’t do that and the whole thing came to a head this afternoon
column3: causing NBC to pay a severance clause of $150K to cancel her contract. NBC spokesman Hugh Levitt told Fox News:

column1: “Megyn Kelly was a superstar until she took on Trump. Now she’s a laughing stock. She could have worked a year or two and made herself $25 million. Instead she’ll spend her days looking for someone else who needs a washed up hasbeen from Fox News who knows nothing but how to piss people off.”
Sorry
column2: Megyn. It’s not like we didn’t all see this coming. Hasta la vista
column3: baby.

column2: who has never been afraid of anyone

column1: One of the men grabbed O’Reilly and dragged him out into the street
column2: according to witnesses
column3: where the other two men proceeded to kick him until he was unconscious and bleeding. The 5 perpetrators
column4: who are still at large
column5: ran off like the cowards they are. The police arrived within minutes and called for medical help.

column1: O’Reilly was taken to St. Vincent’s where he is in critical condition with 4 broken ribs and a punctured lung. Doctors also fear that he had a cardiac event and have him on a monitor. They are hopeful
column2: but with O’Reilly’s age and the extent of his injuries
column3: he may not make it through.

column1: The family is asking for privacy at this difficult time and police are asking for anyone with cell phone pictures or videos of the incident to contact them. So far nobody has come forward other than more New York liberals who say O’Reilly “got what he deserved” for allegedly harassing women in the workplace.

column1: 73	"We all get lazy from time to time and just want to quit everything
column2: crawl back to bed under a layer of blankets and live there until we feel better. We might feel a bit guilty but a relaxing day in bed sounds awesome. Even though it’s a luxury which few of us can afford
column3: at least we can all fantasize about it.

column1: If you’re one of those who are in desperate need of some peace and relaxation
column2: NASA might offer you the perfect opportunity to do so and get payed on top of it. But it may involve a bit more relaxation than you’re prepared for.

column1: NASA has put out an ad looking for people who’re willing to take part in their “Rest Studies” – a study which will require participant to spend 70 straight days in bed
column2: relaxing and smoking different types of cannabis
column3: for which they will receive a salary of 18.000 USD. During the relaxation period participants are allowed to read books
column4: play games
column5: Skype and smoke weed. They can do whatever they want as long as it involves staying in bed
column6: week after week
column7: earning a cool 1200 USD per week.

column1: So what is the exact purpose of these studies?

These studies have the purpose of figuring out the best way to preserve astronauts’ health and safety during periods of prolonged space travel. Complete rest and relaxation is the best way to stimulate zero gravity in space because zero gravity actually means zero weight or strain on your muscle. Additionally
column2: they wanted to see how marijuana will affect the body in such an environment.

column1: The Rest Study is a very convenient way to examine the changes our body endures during space travel.
This study is designed to achieve three core tasks:
Examining how the astronauts’ changing physiology in space could affect the process of certain missions.
Examining if the astronauts’ physiological state could affect their ability to perform in particular tasks.
Preparing countermeasures to combat any impairment that these physiological conditions may impose.
The study’s participants were divided into two groups: exercising and non-exercising.
The exercising group will have to exercise (on a specially designed equipment to maintain the laying down position and smoke cannabis)
column2: while the non-exercising group will just have to lie down and relax completely.

column1: The entire study will last somewhere between 97 and 105
column2: depending on whether you’re in the exercising or non-exercising group.

column1: Once the study begins
column2: during the initial 13 days (non-exercising subjects) and 21 days (exercising subjects) you can move around the bed rest area freely
column3: in and out of bed. But once this period ends
column4: for the next 70 days you’ll be forbidden from leaving your bed. For 70 days you’ll have to lie down
column5: with your feet up
column6: kick back and enjoy! You’ll get out of bed only for a few tests and nothing more. 70 days of complete lazing.

column1: During the study
column2: NASA will have to conduct bone
column3: muscle and heart tests
column4: as well as tests of your circulatory and nervous systems
column5: your nutritional condition
column6: and your body’s immunity system.

column1: But is it worth it?
You may not think so at first
column2: but spending two whole months in bed can be really excruciating. At some point you may feel like you can’t take it anymore but at least you can rest assured that your efforts will help in the advancement of human space travel.

ROCKFORD
column2: Illinois – During a radio interview this morning
column3: Hollywood actor Vin Diesel took a moment to praise Rockford
column4: Illinois residents who had helped him with a mechanical issue with his rental car as he passed through the city recently:

column1: “We were just leaving the city limits of Rockford
column2: Illinois when the damn car overheated or something so I pulled it over to the side of the road and within just a minute or two there were a couple of cars that pulled over to help me out. I told them that I was on the phone with the rental car company but one of them had a brother who owned a tow truck and a few minutes later it was there and he towed it to a place nearby to get fixed.

column1: So then the one guy finds out that I’m not from there and offers to take me in to get lunch while my car is getting fixed and I’m thinking
column2: ‘Sure
column3: what the hell.’ So we drove to the finest dining spot in Rockford – some place on State Street
column4: I think – and got a burger. Great freakin’ burger too. These guys had no idea who I was either which made my day
column5: honestly.

column1: I’m telling you
column2: these people in Rockford are the real deal. I’m going to move there after I retire
column3: ” Diesel said with a laugh.

column1: Diesel added later
column2: “You have to understand
column3: this is something that would’ve never happened in L.A.! So yeah
column4: that’s my story about Rockford
column5: Illinois. It’s nice to know there are still places like this in America.”

column1: 86	"ROCHESTER
column2: New Hampshire – During a radio interview this morning
column3: Hollywood actor Bill Murray took a moment to praise Rochester
column4: New Hampshire residents who had helped him with a mechanical issue with his rental car as he passed through the city recently:

column1: “We were just leaving the city limits of Rochester
column2: New Hampshire when the damn car overheated or something so I pulled it over to the side of the road and within just a minute or two there were a couple of cars that pulled over to help me out. I told them that I was on the phone with the rental car company but one of them had a brother who owned a tow truck and a few minutes later it was there and he towed it to a place nearby to get fixed.

column1: So then the one guy finds out that I’m not from there and offers to take me in to get lunch while my car is getting fixed and I’m thinking
column2: “Sure
column3: what the hell.” So we drove to the finest dining spot in Rochester – some place called Wild Willy’s – and get a burger. Great freakin’ burger too. These guys had no idea who I was either which made my day
column4: honestly.

column1: I’m telling you
column2: these people in Rochester are the real deal. I’m gonna move there after I retire
column3: ” Murray said with a laugh.

column1: Murray added later
column2: “You have to understand
column3: this is something that would’ve never happened in L.A.! So yeah
column4: that’s my story about Rochester. It’s nice to know there are still places like this in America.”

The Obama Administration feels that the American dollar is in bad need of a makeover.  They have partnered with the Dollar ReDe$ign Project to pick a new design for U.S. currency.  Currently
column2: the design that the administration likes best was done by Dowling Duncan (a British duo)
column3: which features a unique vertical design.  It also features President Obama on the one dollar bill.

column1: “We love the Dowling Duncan look.  They’ve come up with a creative design and put President Obama where he belongs… on number 1

column3: Senior Adviser to President Obama.

column1: The Dollar Redesign Project was organized by creative strategy consultant Richard Smith.  He is still soliciting ideas for the dollar bill of the future. “Our great ‘rival’
